screens.name: Links_to_created_PO_and_Work_Order
screens.label: Links to created PO and Work Order

fields.name: DisplayTxtLinks
fields.fieldText:
A {!Picklist_select_the_Type_of_Purchase_Order} purchase order has been created

https://chumley.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Purchase_Order__c/{!var_CreatedPurchaseOrderData.Id}/view

screens.name: Notes_on_Prod_Req_and_POs_from_MATT
screens.label: Notes on Prod Req and POs from MATT

fields.name: ReferenceNotesFromMatt
fields.fieldText:
the charge for fixed price work orders is all "what we expect" and NOT "what we have done".i.e. we decide labour charge by estimating how many hours would be required, and we decide materials charge by listing the "Required Products".

If we estimate we need 2 hours of labour, we have a rate so can work out the charge. the actual time spent is irrelevant as the client pays the expected labour and engineer gets paid his percentage of this.

If we estimate we will need 100 of materials, this is added as a "Required Product" and the charge is taken form this. When the estimate is accepted, we then create the POs and Expense claims, but this does not affect the charge (just the costs).


Setting the CCT record type as "F" on CCT will cause the "Materials Charge" field to use the "required product total" and not the "po and expense total"

Please contact the office.

screens.name: ScreenCredit_or_Key_Account_WO_is_not_Accepted
screens.label: Credit or Key Account WO is not Accepted

fields.name: DTxtCredit_or_Key_Account_WO_is_not_Accepted
fields.fieldText:
Work Order {!var_WorkOrderData.WorkOrderNumber} is currently in a Status of {!var_WorkOrderData.Status}.


Credit or Key Account Work Orders must be in a Status of Accepted in order to create a Purchase Order.

screens.name: ScreenDisplay_Sums_of_PO_Prod_Req_and_Van_Stock_Prod_Req_FP_Got_SA
screens.label: Display Sums of PO Prod Req and Van Stock Prod Req

fields.name: DisplayTxt_Sums_of_PO_Prod_Req_and_Van_Stock_Prod_Req
fields.fieldText:
Currently Work Order {!var_WorkOrderData.WorkOrderNumber} has the following totals for Product Required:


Purchase Order Product Required: {!var_WorkOrderData.Sum_of_WO_PO_Product_Required__c}


Van Stock Product Required: {!var_WorkOrderData.Sum_of_WO_Van_Stock_Product_Required__c}


Scaffolding Product Required: {!var_WorkOrderData.Sum_of_WO_Scaffolding_Product_Required__c}


Total of all Product Required: {!var_WorkOrderData.Sum_of_WO_Product_Required__c}


When you're raising a Purchase Order please take care that the total of all Purchase Orders does not exceed the total of all Product Required.


Further Info:


The charge for Fixed Price Work Orders is all "what we expect" and NOT "what we have done" i.e. we decide labour charge by estimating how many hours would be required, and we decide materials charge by adding the Product Required records.


If we estimate we will need 100 of materials, this is added as a "Product Required" and the charge is taken from this. When the Estimate is accepted, we then create the POs and Expense claims, but this does not affect the charge (just the costs).

When you're raising a Purchase Order please take care that the total of all Purchase Orders does not exceed the total of all Product Required.


Further Info:


The charge for Fixed Price Work Orders is all "what we expect" and NOT "what we have done" i.e. we decide labour charge by estimating how many hours would be required, and we decide materials charge by adding the Product Required records.


If we estimate we will need 100 of materials, this is added as a "Product Required" and the charge is taken from this. When the Estimate is accepted, we then create the POs and Expense claims, but this does not affect the charge (just the costs).

fields.name: DisplayTxt_Sums_of_PO_Prod_Req_and_Van_Stock_Prod_Req_0_0
fields.fieldText:
REACTIVE Screen (testing only)


If WO record type = Reactive, show separate screen and update text to Reactive PO's information (e.g. show "the charge for Fixed Price Work Orders is all "what we expect" and NOT "wwhat we have done" etc) @Matthew Radoja to provide this text. 



Currently Work Order {!var_WorkOrderData.WorkOrderNumber} has the following totals for Product Required:


Purchase Order Product Required: {!var_WorkOrderData.Sum_of_WO_PO_Product_Required__c}


Van Stock Product Required: {!var_WorkOrderData.Sum_of_WO_Van_Stock_Product_Required__c}


When you're raising a Purchase Order please take care that the total of all Purchase Orders does not exceed the total of all Product Required.


Further Info:


The charge for Fixed Price Work Orders is all "what we expect" and NOT "what we have done" i.e. we decide labour charge by estimating how many hours would be required, and we decide materials charge by adding the Product Required records.


If we estimate we will need 100 of materials, this is added as a "Product Required" and the charge is taken from this. When the Estimate is accepted, we then create the POs and Expense claims, but this does not affect the charge (just the costs).

If we estimate we will need 100 of materials, this is added as a "Product Required" and the charge is taken from this. When the Estimate is accepted, we then create the POs and Expense claims, but this does not affect the charge (just the costs).

A Service Appointment was not found for Work Order: {!var_WorkOrderData.WorkOrderNumber}.


Right now, a Service Appointment that has been allocated to an Operative/Service Resource must exist for this process to work.
